title: Interesting discussion with a colleague - how many average potatoes would you need to line up end to end, to make up 1 AU? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, 1 AU is the distance to the Sun from Texas (about.)! If a potato is about 4 inches it would take: 3 x 5280 x 93000000 = about 15 x 10 ^11 potatoes Now thats Idaho potatoes. If they were Texas potatoes it would only take about 3 x 10^11 Next

Hmmmn. Good question. I need to defer to the Aussies here on Quora though: How long is the average AU? I mean, really, are we talking diameter, maximum length (horizontal from East to West), maximum height (North-South), average height (of male or females, or both) circumference, or “Ayers rocks per fortnight” now?
